intro: Noccaea campylophylla, commonly known as the bent-leaf stonecress, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is characterized by its small, rounded leaves that curve inward. Its flowers are white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Noccaea campylophylla is often found in alpine or subalpine regions, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
